prompt:
[Bold button] ![dropdown:Drop_Down_4893_400]

[Font selection button with “Times New Roman” shown]![dropdown:Drop_Down_4893_401]

[Center text button] ![dropdown:Drop_Down_4893_402]

[Numbered list button] ![dropdown:Drop_Down_4893_403]
description: Identify the function of each of these buttons.
feedback: These are common buttons to find in word processors, and they help with basic formatting. The button to make a numbered list looks like a small numbered list, with numbered lines. The button to make text bold looks like a bold letter “B,” and the one to center the text looks like some centered lines. They all look like the formatting you’re trying to make. The button to select a font shows the name of the font you’re using, and usually has an arrow or other symbol to show that you can choose a different font.
